intro: Navarretia saximontana, commonly known as the Sierra Lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Navarretia saximontana is an ephemeral plant, completing its life cycle quickly in response to seasonal rainfall.
